turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Why you brought Glenn into this, I'll never know.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: How 'bout the score was his idea to begin with?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: His idea?  Gimme a break.  Fuckin' guy's got a vacant lot for a head.  Was you and me figured the whole thing out.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I don't know why, but every time he opens his mouth I want to punch him out.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: He ain't the problem, Jack.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: You want to take her to my place and get cleaned up?  You come out of the bathroom with your after-shave on and she goes, "Oh, I had you all wrong"?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I want to talk to her again, that's all.  See what would happen under, you know, normal circumstances.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: You're too late, Jack.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I'm just saying she wasn't scared.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Cause she had her hand on her gun the whole time, waiting to make her move.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You're just jealous it was me in the trunk with her and not you.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: You're right.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I've been dreaming about a hot bath for the last six months.  Soak the prison off me.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: There's some lilac oil, you want some, a vanilla candle under the sink.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Oh, man.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: There's something about a nice hot bath, transforms a person.  It's not just about opening up your pores, know what I mean?  There's just something about the heat and the wet that's calming you know?  Settles me in a way that I really can't articulate.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I know exactly what you mean.  It's just a feeling.  You know, I could go for some wine tonight.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: There's a store around the corner, I'll be right back.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Sounds great.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: They pass this picture around you can go anywhere you want, nobody'll know you.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I wasn't feeling my best that day. I'd just drawn thirty to life.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Maybe this'll make you feel better.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Paper says there's ten grand each on you, Chino and Lulu.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Say anything in there about Karen Sisco?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Just that she got away.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Yeah, but what happened after she drove off with Glenn?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: You'll have to ask Glenn.  And most likely, he's on his way to Detroit, where we should be.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Think this old guy is her boyfriend? It's the only picture she carries.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Am I going to Detroit by myself?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Longer we hang around down here, Jack, better chance there is either Glenn's gonna fuck up the whole score, or we gonna get busted, or both.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: We'll leave first thing in the morning.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: You better come see this.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Chino's gonna wanna talk to me.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: He's running for his life, he doesn't give a shit about you.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: He's gotta know by now that I gave him up back at Glades.  He does, he's gonna try to find me.  Maybe go see Adele, see what she knows.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: He knows where she lives?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Jack?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: We were talking one time, drinking rum.  I may've mentioned Adele, how she worked for a magician.  Chino got interested.  He's like, Yeah?  How does he saw the woman in half?  He wanted to meet her.  Or get a look at her if she ever came to visit.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: So call her up.  Tell her don't talk to any Cubans.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Her phone's probably tapped.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: And you know they're gonna have some people watching the hotel.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Nice disguise.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I'm a tourist.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: You at least bring the gun?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: In here with my suntan lotion and beach towel.  That's her place.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: There.  You see the guy sitting on the porch?  The old ladies and one guy? You know they'll have a couple more in a car somewhere.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Uh-huh...

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I guess Adele's in good hands.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Sure looks that way.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Let's go to Detroit.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Now you're talkin'.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: First thing we do, we get to Detroit, we find Glenn, then we find a window to throw him out of.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: I been thinkin', if I was Glenn, I was up there to take down the Ripper, where would I go?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Well, first off, if you were Glenn, you wouldn't be thinking.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Remember Snoopy Miller, his old pal from Lompoc?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Snoopy.  Christ, I thought he'd be brain dead by now.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: He isn't fighting no more.  Glenn told me the Snoop's been managing some guys up there now, works out at the Kronk.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: They know where I live, I guess they know what I drive, so maybe we should pick up another car on the way.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: She just sat there, looking right at me.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: "Fight over tuna casserole may have spurred slaying."  Seems this woman's live-in boyfriend, seventy years old, complained about her tuna noodle casserole and she shot him in the face with a twelve-gauge.  Police found noodles in the woman's hair and think the guy dumped the casserole dish on her before she shot him.  They'd been together ten years.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Love is funny.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Whatta you think?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I think Glenn opened his big mouth and now we got us another partner.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Or two.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Is that Snoopy?  In the purple doo rag?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: What's he do now, tell fortunes?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Outside of that.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Doesn't say what she's doing up here, but I don't think it has anything to do with us.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: She came up here on her vacation, 'cause she likes shitty weather.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I think she's after Glenn.  The girl still with you?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: They don't stay the night, Jack, 'less you pay for it.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You tell your sister about it?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Just hung up.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: How long you talk to her?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Two hours.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: How long were you with the girl?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Forty-five minutes.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You didn't tell your sister about Ripley, did you?  'Cause I don't wanna go through that again.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Forget about my sister.  If Karen Sisco's tailing Glenn, we're fucked. Tomorrow night at the fights we all get picked up.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Let's drive by where we're meeting and have a look.  Maybe take a look at Ripley's place while we're at it.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Now that's a really big house.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Jesus, look at that wall.  Place almost looks like a prison.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: No doubt the man's got some big-ass security system.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Time comes, we knock on the door.  See if he wants to talk about old times. Go in the easy way.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Yeah?  You think he'll let us in, we got Snoopy and the muscle-bound asshole with us?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Who says anybody's gonna be with us? I say we go to the fights tomorrow, find out what the Snoop's big plan is, then go in ahead of those guys -- <u>alone</u>.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Let Glenn deal with the Snoop, while we're off livin' the good life.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Tell me something, Buddy.  You know anyone who's actually done one last big score and gone to live the good life?  Cause it occurred to me that everyone <u>talks</u> about doing it, but I don't know anyone who's actually gone and <u>done</u> it.  Do you?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: What about that D.B. Cooper guy?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: I mean, they don't know for sure he's dead.  Look, there's always a chance we'll walk out've there with nothing.  I say let fate decide.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Let fate decide?  What're you, the fuckin' Dali Lama now?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: My sister believes in fate, but not hell.  That's why she stopped praying for the lost souls since you don't hear that much about purgatory anymore. But every day she asks her boss to pray I don't fuck up.  Whatta you think, you think there's a hell, Jack?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Yeah, it's called Glades Correctional Institution and I'm sure as shit not going back there or any place like it.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: You might not have a choice.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: They put a gun on you, you'll go back.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: They put a gun on you, you still have a choice, don't you?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Listen, I gotta get some better shoes, few other things before tomorrow.  Why don't you drop me off at the Ren Cen, we'll hook up later?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Yeah, and I better call my sister.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: It took you, what, seven hours to buy a pair of shoes?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I saw Karen Sisco.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: And she saw you?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Yes, she did.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: So how's that work, a wanted felon socializing with a U.S. Marshal?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You know how I felt about her.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Did you give her a jump?  If you did I might begin to understand where your head's at.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: It wasn't about getting laid.  I just wanted to know what might've happened if things were different.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: You find out?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Yeah, I did.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: So what's that mean?  That you're disappointed by what you found or you're sorry you robbed all those banks?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: They want to go tonight, before Glenn gets in any trouble, opens his big mouth.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Whatta you wanna do?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: You know they gonna set us up.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I get that feeling, yeah.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: But you still think you can get the diamonds fore they do?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I'll make you a deal.  Get out of here. Right now.  I'll do the job with the Snoop, meet you wherever you want and give you half.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Half for doing what?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Getting me out of Glades for starters.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: And who watches your back?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: There's still time, take me up on my offer.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: I'm not leaving you alone with these assholes.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You ever wear one of these?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: I don't ski.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Stay with the maid.  I'm gonna have a look around.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: They found the safe.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You remember Buddy, don't you, Richard?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Yeah, hi.  Nice house.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: They look like plain old rocks.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: They sure do.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: They're gonna rape the maid, aren't they.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: From the looks of those boys, the Ripper too.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: And then they'll kill 'em.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: At least.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: We made it, didn't we?

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: All you gotta do is get in.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I'm going back inside.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: I'll go with you.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: No, you dump the van, meet me at the airport. I'll take one of Ripley's cars.

turns.speaker: BUDDY
turns.text: Jack --

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Listen, Buddy, the shit that's about to go down, you'll be on the phone with your sister for a month.  Let me do this part alone.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Hello, Daniel.

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: Daniel Burdon, FBI.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I wanna be on the task force, Daniel.

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: That's nice of you to offer, Karen, but I got all the help I can use right now.  Instead, let's talk about how you got the bump on your head.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Isn't that my report you're holding onto?

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: Yes, but I want to hear you tell it. Starting with when you tried to grab the wheel -- where was this?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Coming to the Okeechobee exit...

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: There's a couple of points I keep wondering about have to do with the two guys that grabbed you.  Buddy is it?  And this fella Jack Foley.  I swear the man must've robbed two hundred banks in his time.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Really?  Huh.  He told me he didn't remember how many he robbed.

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: You talked to him?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: In the trunk, yeah?

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: What'd you talk about?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Oh... different things, prison, movies.

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: This fella holds you hostage, you talk about movies?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: It was an unusual experience.

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: Foley made me think of that fella Carl Tillman, the one you were seeing, it turns out the same time he was doing banks.  You recall that?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: When I was seeing Carl Tillman, I didn't know he robbed banks.

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: Yeah, but I had enough reason to believe he did, and I told you.  So you had to at least suspect him.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: And what happened to Carl?

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: The time came, you shot him.  But you didn't shoot Foley or the guy with him.  They're unarmed, you had a shotgun and you let them throw you in the trunk. Okay, now you got your Sig in your hand.  You say in the report you couldn't turn around, he had you pinned down.  But when the trunk opened, how come you didn't cap the two guys then?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Is that what you would've done?

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: You say in the report Glenn didn't have a gun, but you let him get away, too.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Daniel, what do you work on most of the time, fraud?  Go after crooked bookkeepers.

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: Karen, I've been with the Bureau fifteen years, on all kinds of investigations.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Have you ever shot a man?  How many times have you been primary through the door?

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: I have to qualify, is that it?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You have to know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: We'll talk another time, Karen.  All right?  I'd like to know why Foley put you in that second car when he didn't need you any more.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You'll have to ask him.

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: Sounds to me like he liked having you around.  I'll see you, Karen.  Mr. Sisco.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: Karen.  Where are you?  I been trying to get a hold of you.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Daniel.  Listen --

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: Where are you?  I been trying to reach you.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I'm at Adele Delisi's.

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: What-- we already talked to her.  That's a dead end.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Yeah, I know.  I was just leaving. Why were you trying to reach me?

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: There was a Buddy Bragg at Lompoc around the same time Foley was there.  We got an address for him at the Adams Hotel in Hallandale.  I want you to go there, see if you can get the manager to i.d. him as the other guy.  If he does, you call me right away...

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: All right, but...

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: But don't you <u>do</u> anything.  You just have a seat, wait for me to get there.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Sure, Daniel.

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: Now.  What is it you wanted to tell me?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Oh, I was just wondering, if I were to bring in Chirino, would you put me on the task force?

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: What?  Is that what you're calling me about?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Yes or no, Daniel.  If I get him, will you let me go after Foley?

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: Yeah, sure, Karen.  You bring in Chirino, you can be on the task force.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: That's all I wanted to know.

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: Good.  Now forget about the ex-wife and get over to the Adams Hotel.

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: You get the key?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: They're in 7D.

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: You're primary, you're secondary, you're point man.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You're gonna use a ram?

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: Yeah, why?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: The manager's door is metal.

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: Take the radio, stay down here in the lobby, watch the elevator.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What?  Daniel, I wanna go upstairs.

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: You can go wait out in the car, you want to.

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: Now you see Foley and this guy Bragg come in behind us, whatta you do?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Call and tell you.

turns.speaker: BURDON
turns.text: And you let them come up.  You don't try to make the bust yourself.  You understand?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Leave it where it is.

turns.speaker: CHINO
turns.text: Wait.  You not Adele?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I'm a federal marshal and you're under arrest.  Put the gun on the table.  I mean, now.

turns.speaker: CHINO
turns.text: Oh.  Then this must be Adele...

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Put it down or I'll shoot.

turns.speaker: CHINO
turns.text: You wouldn't shoot me, would you?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What do you want to bet?

turns.speaker: CHINO
turns.text: I could walk out of here.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: If you move, if you look at her again, you're dead.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You can live or die, it's up to you.

turns.speaker: CHINO
turns.text: Oh, is that right?  You going to shoot me?  Nice girl like you?  I don't think so.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You don't, huh?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Daniel Burdon, please.  Karen Sisco.

turns.speaker: CHINO
turns.text: Excuse me, Adele?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You excited?

turns.speaker: CHINO
turns.text: I told you, man, Super Bowl Sunday.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Yeah, but I see you moved it up.

turns.speaker: CHINO
turns.text: Why you think is today?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You were out running this morning, sticking to your routine, anybody happened to notice.  But you only did a couple of miles instead of your usual five.  Saving yourself for the main event.  Then I see you inside eating ten pounds of macaroni. Carbohydrates for endurance.

turns.speaker: CHINO
turns.text: You want, I tole you you can come. You all right, Foley.  I like you.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You told me I can come 'cause I caught you digging the fuckin' tunnel, saw you and Lulu coming out of the bushes, thought maybe you two were making out.

turns.speaker: CHINO
turns.text: You see what they doing, those posts out there?  Putting up another fence, five metres on the other side of the one that's there.  We wait until Super Bowl Sunday, they could have the second fence built and we have to dig another nine, ten days.  So we going soon as it's dark.  You want -- I mean it -- you can still come.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I appreciate the offer.  And it's tempting.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Ironic, isn't it?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: How are you, Raymond?

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Freezing.  But I'm getting warmer.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Quite a mess.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Yeah.  And I thought everyone liked Eddie.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Dude in the dress is Eddie Solomon, used to buy scag off a corner till he kicked it and found his happiness with crack and then started dealing himself. Word on the street was he was saving up for an operation.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What is it with crack and transsexuals?

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Yeah, Eddie was a real character.  Had these girls cooked the rocks he called the Rockettes.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Yeah.  I saw one of 'em outside.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Yonelle.  Looks like someone raped her, shot her, then threw her out the window.  Fuckin' animals.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Other than we had so much fun the last time we worked together.  You gonna tell me why you're comin' to me instead of the FBI?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I report to the FBI, first thing they're gonna do is ask me to go get some coffee.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: You know, I'm not in homicide any more.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: No, I didn't know that.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Yeah, I'm crimes against persons and property now, also sex crimes and child abuse.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Detroit, you must be pretty busy.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Yeah, and, as you can see, home invasions are big, too.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Listen, Raymond, a year ago, DEA had this guy Glenn Michaels on possession with intent but couldn't make it stick. In his statement, Glenn said he went up to Detroit to visit a friend and look into job opportunities -- if you can believe that.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Who was the friend?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Guy named Maurice Miller, also known as Snoopy, a former prizefighter.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Christ, I know Snoopy Miller.  He's a fuckin' wackjob thinks he's Sugar Ray Leonard.  Hangs out with a couple other Grade-A nutcases over on the West side.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I'll need a last known address.

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: That's fine, but I don't want you to talk to Miller alone.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Come on, Raymond, I'm a federal officer, I'm armed.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: We're a few minutes away.  Just sit tight, stay outta the house till we get there, understand?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Oh-kay...

turns.speaker: CRUZ
turns.text: Karen, I told you not to--

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Wait, I know him --okay?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Sign says "Shut the fuck up."  Or can't you guys read?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: There a problem, Foley?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Yeah, I got a problem.  This is the dumbest fucking shakedown in the history of dump shakedowns.  Three hundred bucks for a pillow?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: How much for your company at chow?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Company, shit.  I watch the man's back.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I bet.  How much?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Another C.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: This doesn't concern you, Foley.  Why don't you go on out to the yard, have yourself a smoke?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I don't smoke.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Himey here's a pro-toh-jay of mine. He's ranked number thirty-two in the federal prison system.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Thirty-two outta what, twenty?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Snoopy Miller, famous fight thrower.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: It seems to me I been reading about you in the newspaper.  Busted out of some joint in Florida, huh?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Low class of people there, Snoop.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Like being back in the yard, huh?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Just like it.  Nobody backing down. You back down, you pussy.  Tell me what you and Buddy doing up here in the cold?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Glenn didn't tell you?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Look, Snoop, I don't know what Glenn promised you or what you think you're gonna get, but the deal is me and Buddy get half of whatever we take from Ripley, understand?  How you and Glenn cut up the rest is up to you.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Let's go outside and talk.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: What's the matter with right here? It's nice and warm.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Warm?  Man, it's ninety-five degrees in here, sometimes a hundred -- the way Emanuel always kep' it so his boys'd sweat, get lean and mean like Tommy Hearns.  No, I ain't talking any business in here.  To me this is holy ground, man.  You understand?  I got to be someplace anyway.  Y'all want to talk, come to the fights tomorrow night, we'll sit down and look at it good. The State Theater.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Who's sitting here?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Your homie, Glenn.  Only thing, he went to the men's about a while ago and never came back.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Reggie, push off and hit, man.  Push him off.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: We're leaving.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: The fuck you talking about?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Snoop, if you don't know where Glenn is...

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Look, what you worried about Glenn for?  What's he know?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I thought everything.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Soon as we leave here.  Stop home and pick up what we need and go do it.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Give me a minute, talk to Buddy.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: You got two minutes, that's all.  Make up your mind.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I wasn't asking permission.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: That what they're wearing these days to break and enter?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Break and enter, shit.  Take it and git, how it's done.  Don't waste any time.  That's how you do it.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: So you've done this before, huh?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Shit, yeah.  White Boy even got busted for it.  White Boy, tell these boys the reason you went down on that burglary that time.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Takes the TV, the VCR, some other shit and leaves his wallet on the floor.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: That's a wonderful story, Snoop.  I'm very excited about tonight.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Hey.  You learn from doing.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: You know how to use one a these?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I've seen 'em used on TV.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Good luck, Richard.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Someone down here?

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Jack, you don't use a gun, do you?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Not until recently.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: Nervous?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: A little.

turns.speaker: MAURICE
turns.text: This kind of setup, you don't have any idea what the fuck you're doing -- do you?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You're right.  So why take a chance--

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Why you're just a girl.  What do you do for a living you pack a shotgun?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I'm a federal marshal and you're under arrest, both of you guys.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You comfy?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: If I could have a little more room.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: There isn't any.  All this shit you got in here.  What is all this stuff anyway?  Handcuffs, chains... what's this can?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: For your breath.  You could use it. Squirt some in your mouth.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You devil, it's mace, huh?  What've you got here, a billy?  Use it on poor unfortunate offenders.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Where's your gun, your pistol?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: In my bag, in the car.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Boy, it stunk in there.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I believe it.  You've ruined a nine- hundred-dollar suit my dad gave me.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Yeah, went real nice with that twelve gauge, too.  Tell me, why in the world would someone like you ever become a federal marshall?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: The idea of going after guys like you appealed to me.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Guys like me, huh.  Well, listen, even though I've been celibate lately, I'm not gonna force myself on you.  I've never done that in my life.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You wouldn't have time anyway.  We come to a roadblock, they'll run the car, find out in five seconds who it belongs to.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: If they get set up in time, which I doubt.  And even if they do they'll be looking for a buncha little Latin fellas, not a big black guy driving a Ford.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Must be quite a pal, risk his own ass like this.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Who, Buddy?  Yeah.  He's a good guy. Back when we jailed together, he'd call his sister every week without fail.  She's a born-again Christian, does bookkeeping for a televangelist. Buddy calls her up, confesses his sins, tells her about whatever bank he happened to rob.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Buddy.  That's his given name?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: One I gave him, yeah.  Fuck...

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: So, what's <u>your</u> name?  It'll be in the paper tomorrow anyway.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Jack Foley.  You've probably heard of me.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Why, are you famous?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Time I was convicted in California? FBI told me I'd robbed more banks than anyone in the computer.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: How many was that?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Tell you the truth, I don't know.  I started when I was eighteen, driving for my Uncle Cully and his partner, Gus.  They go into a bank this one time in Slidell, Gus jumps the counter to get the tellers and breaks his leg. All three of us ended up in Angola.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: That's funny.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I thought so, too.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: It was me, I woulda left ol' Gus on the floor.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I believe you would have.  Another fall, I did seven years at Lompoc.  And I don't mean the place next door where some of Nixon's people went.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I know the difference.  You were in Lompoc USP, the federal penitentiary. I've delivered people there.  So basically you've spent half your life in prison.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Basically.  Yeah.  If I go back now, I do a full thirty years, no time off. Can you imagine looking at that?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I don't have to.  I don't rob banks.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You don't seem all that scared.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Of course I am.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You don't act like it.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What do you want me to do?  Scream?  I don't think it would help much.  I'm just gonna sit back, take it easy, and wait for you to screw up.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Jesus, you sound like my ex-wife.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You were married?  All those falls, I'm surprised you had time.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: It was just a year, give or take a few days.  I mean, it's not like we didn't get along or anything.  We had fun, we just didn't have that... that thing, you know?  That spark, you know what I mean?  You gotta have that.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: We still talk, though.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You know, this isn't gonna end well, these things never do.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Yeah, well, if it turns out I get shot like a dog, it'll be in the street, not off a goddamn fence.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You must see yourself as some kind of Clyde Barrow.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Oh, you mean of Bonnie and Clyde?  Hm. You ever see pictures of him, the way he wore his hat?  You could tell he had that don't-give-a-shit air about him.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I don't recall his hat, but I've seen pictures of him lying dead, shot by Texas Rangers.  Did you know he didn't have his shoes on?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Is that right?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: They put a hundred and eighty-seven bullet holes in Clyde, Bonnie Parker and the car they were driving.  Bonnie was eating a sandwich.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You're full of interesting facts, aren't you?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: It was May, 1934, near Gibsland, Louisiana.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: That part in the movie where they get shot?  Warren Beatty and... I can't think of her name.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Faye Dunaway.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Yeah, I liked her in that movie about TV...

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Network. Yeah, she was good.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: And the guy saying he wasn't gonna take any more shit from anybody...

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Peter Finch.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Yeah, right.  Anyway, that scene where Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway get shot?  I remember thinking at the time it wouldn't be a bad way to go, if you have to.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Bleeding on a country road.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: It wasn't pretty after, no, but if you were in that car -- eating a sandwich -- you wouldn't have known what hit you.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You're sure easy to talk to.  I wonder -- say we met under different circumstances and got to talking, say you were in a bar and I came up to you -- I wonder what would happen.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I mean if you didn't know who I was.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You'd probably tell me.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I'm just saying I think if we met under different circumstances...

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You have to be kidding.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Another one Faye Dunaway was in I liked, Three Days of the Condor.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: With Robert Redford, when he was young.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I never thought it made sense, though, the way they got together so quick.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Really.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I mean, romantically.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Uh-huh.  Well, but if --

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Get your hands up and turn around. <u>Now</u>.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Shit...

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You know who this is?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: How'd you get this number?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Who was it answered the phone?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: None of your business.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I'm just worried maybe I'm not old enough for you.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: That's my dad.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Really.  He has a cop's face.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: How do you know?  Wait-- you have my wallet.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: And your gun.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Think I could have them back?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: How do we do that?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Let's see.  You could come on by my dad's place, drop 'em off.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Sure.  I'll just leave 'em with the S.W.A.T. guy answers the door.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: There's a guy here on the task force right now.  Maybe I should put him on the phone, let you two work it out.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You won't do that.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Because you're having too much fun.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: My dad's retired.  He was a Private Investigator.  Forty years.  I used to work for him.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I can just picture that, a cute girl like you following slip-and-fall and whiplash cheaters.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Something I've been wondering, what ever happened to your Uncle Cully?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Why?  You think he might tell you where I am?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Unless you wanna tell me.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: He's dead.  He did twenty-seven years before he came out and died not too long after in Charity Hospital, I think trying to make up for all the good times he'd missed.  That's not gonna be me.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: One last score, that the idea?  Move to some island.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I'm partial to mountains myself.  But if you like islands, we'll make it an island.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Whatta you mean <u>we'll</u> make it an island?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I just thought maybe you and me could--

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: It takes hours to get a drink around here.  There's only one waitress.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I can go to the bar.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Don't leave me.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Those guys bother you?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: No, they're all right.  I meant, you just got here.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You like bourbon?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Love it.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Well, we got that out of the way.  Tell me, Celeste.  What do you do for a living?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I'm a sales rep.  I came here to call on a customer and they gave me a hard time because I'm a girl.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Is that how you think of yourself?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What, as a sales rep?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: A girl.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I don't have a problem with it.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I like your hair.  And that suit.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I had one just like it -- well, it was the same idea, but I had to get rid of it.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: You did?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: It smelled.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: Having it cleaned didn't help, huh?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: No.  What do you do for a living, Gary?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: How far do we go with this?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Not yet.  Don't say anything yet.  Okay?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: I don't think it works if we're somebody else.  You know what I mean?  Gary and Celeste, Jesus, what do they know about anything?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: It's your game.  I've never played this before.

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: It's not a game.  Something you play.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Well, does it make sense to you?

turns.speaker: FOLEY
turns.text: It doesn't have to, it's something that happens.  It's like seeing a person you never saw before -- you could be passing on the street -- you look at each other and for a few seconds, there's a kind of recognition.  Like you both know something.  But then the next moment the person's gone, and it's too late to do anything about it, but you remember it because it was right there and you let it go, and you think, "What if I had stopped and said something?"  It might happen only a few times in your life.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Or once.
